result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darvis L Bradford

records.addlTxt: Photocopy of Complaint emailed to Milwaukee Housing Authority per request and payment received 8/5/22

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford not in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Darvis L Bradford. Counsel indicates def is not present as he does not have transportation.  Court issues warrant and orders bail forfeiture.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford not in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Darvis L Bradford.  Defendant had transportation issues and wasn't able to appear.  Resolution anticipated; Court authorizes and stays warrant.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Darvis L Bradford. Offer rec'd; counsel req adj for further negotiation.
Plea hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on July 13, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court.  Attorney Nolan A. Jensen in court for Darvis L Bradford. Counsel's first appearance.

Plea hearing on June 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Absolute sobriety. Not be present at Tap House in West Bend. No presence in any establishment whose primary purpose is sale/serving of alcohol.
22R 007530 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #14881 on 4-10-22

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Darvis L Bradford in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $450 cash bond, previously posted.  Court enters NG pleas on behalf of def.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
